text: Gaius Julius Caesar (20 BCâ€“4 AD) was one of two brothers adopted by the first Roman emperor, Augustus. Both died in their early twenties, clearing the path for Tiberius. Gaius Caesar had achieved the rank of Consul before his death.Hazel, John. 2002. Who's Who in the Roman World.
